item.title: BlackRock Sees Growth in Asia Infrastructure on AI Boom
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. sees huge growth opportunities in Asia for infrastructure to support a boom in artificial intelligence that’s also spurring energy and water demand. “The need for data centers over the next five years is going to be double what is currently in the markets,” Brad Kim, Bl...

item.title: SocGen Plans New California Office, Hires Ex-UBS Banker Jansen
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Societe Generale SA hired John Jansen as the bank’s West Coast co-head with responsibility for technology, media and telecommunications investment banking, according to people familiar with the move. Jansen, UBS Group AG’s former head of technology mergers and acquisitions, will be ba...

item.title: French Power Is Underpriced With Demand Set to Recover, BNP Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- French electricity for next year is trading below its real value as the market hasn’t yet priced in higher future demand and stronger exports, according to BNP Paribas SA. The contracts should be as much as 10% higher than where they are currently trading, the bank’s Senior Commoditi...

item.title: HSBC Changes ECB Call, Sees Cut Every Meeting Starting October
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank will start cutting interest rates at every meeting between October and April, according to economists at HSBC. “So even if the supply side of the economy remains weak and the labour market only cools gradually, more policymakers may be persuaded that some ‘in...

item.description: Immobilienaktien wieder interessanter. Immobilienfonds hadern weiter mit Nettomittelabflüssen. Patrick Baldia. item.title: Großbank UBS zweifelt an Tesla und rät Aktionären zum Ausstieg
item.author: FOCUS online
item.description:
Die Schweizer Bank UBS erwartet für die Tesla-Aktie ein Kursniveau von 197 Dollar. Das berichtet Wallstreet-online. Die Kursprognose bedeutet gegenüber dem aktuellen Kurs von 254 Dollar einen Absturz von gut 22 Prozent.
Der Dollar-Kurs der Tesla-Aktie
Diese hohe Einbuße erwartet das Bankhaus, obwo...

item.title: Hochtief und Thomas-Krenn bauen nachhaltige Rechenzentren

item.description: Der Baukonzern Hochtief und der bayerische Serverhersteller Thomas-Krenn haben das Gemeinschaftsunternehmen Yorizon gegründet, um Rechenzentren mit sparsamem Energieverbrauch zu entwickeln.
